Covid19onMap

Source: R/Covid19onMap.R
Covid19onMap.Rd

function to show number of daily confirmed cases or death from covid19, on the world map on a given date

Covid19onMap(data = local_data, date, type, log_scale = FALSE)

Arguments

data

a dataframe that contains covid19 data which can be reached by function Covid19Data(). Default is local_data which is the offline available version of covid19 data stored in the package. Someone can use this default if he/she can't reach the net.
date

a string that indicates a date, possible formats are: "yyyy-m-d" or "yyyy/m/d".
type

a string that indicates type of reported cases, possible values are: "confirmed" and "death".
log_scale

Boolean. if it is TRUE, the number of confirmed cases or death on map will be displayed in logarithmic scale. Default is FALSE.

Value

a world map that the color of every country shows number of new confirmed cases or new death from covid19 on the given date

Examples

if (FALSE) {
newdata <- Covid19Data()
Covid19onMap(newdata, "2020-05-24", "confirmed")
Covid19onMap(newdata, "2020/05/24", "death")
}
